title: Interactive Dropout Analysis with R
text: section describes extract information dropout demo dataset without using dropR shiny UI. First, let’s make sure dema dataset loaded available. dataset look like

title: Interactive Dropout Analysis with R
text: Now, let’s extract dropout, .e., information participant dropped questionnaire never returned. demo dataset questions easily identified prefix vi_ experimental_condition column indicates belonging sub sample group treated differently. example, groups receive different sequence questions different wording. Now, let’s compute table containing basic dropout statistics item. 246 participants demo sample, 236 participants remain survey, accounting 95.93 percent sample. cs column shows cummulative dropout count.
code: qs <- which(grepl("vi_", names(dropRdemo))) # add numeric drop out position to original dataset dropRdemo <- add_dropout_idx(dropRdemo, q_pos = qs) head(dropRdemo[,c(1:3,53,54)]) #>                                     obs_id vi_1 vi_2 vi_52 #> 1 7a9f33c4f660d535556925bf706835fb083ead1f    1    1     1 #> 2 e11f946fd40193aea67e8979bfc69f6b176c9ceb    1   NA  <NA> #> 3 e72a502a213c8be51dbb2c67f3310f08f9be0a67    1   NA     1 #> 4 f90f5f127796583cd8b4297ade58c0ded4cfc982    1    1     1 #> 5 20bc72c82581e0c76d3c846b9c1fdc3357febc2f    1   NA     1 #> 6 76b97a45273d6dcd734896d08e31a0833823e99d    1   NA  <NA> #>   experimental_condition #> 1                     11 #> 2                     22 #> 3                     22 #> 4                     11 #> 5                     12 #> 6                     22 library(kableExtra) stats_table <- compute_stats(dropRdemo,                              by_cond = "experimental_condition",                              no_of_vars = length(qs)) kable(head(stats_table))

title: Interactive Dropout Analysis with R
text: Based statistics table, dropR plots dropout curves conveniently.

what: Running a Chi-sq. Test for a Selected Question
title: Running DropOut related Tests Within R
text: NOTE: Chi-sq. tests available column denoting experimental condition given. Let’s compute Chisq test question 15 experimentatl conditions 11 12, dropR’s dropout Chisq-Test returns list containing actual test results dropout overview table selected question.
code: do_chisq(stats_table,          chisq_question = 15,          sel_cond_chisq = c('11','12'),          fisher = TRUE) #> $`Test result` #>  #>  Pearson's Chi-squared test with simulated p-value (based on 2000 #>  replicates) #>  #> data:  test_table #> X-squared = 1.9315, df = NA, p-value = 0.2214 #>  #>  #> $`Dropout at question 15` #>           participants #> conditions dropout remaining #>         11      14        58 #>         12       6        51

title: Running DropOut related Tests Within R

Plot Dropout Curves — plot_do_curve
text: functions uses ggplot create drop curves.

title: Plot Dropout Curves — plot_do_curve
code: plot_do_curve(   d,   linetypes = TRUE,   stroke_width = 1,   full_scale = TRUE,   show_points = FALSE,   color_palette = "color_blind" )

title: Plot Dropout Curves — plot_do_curve
text: d data.frame containing dropout statistics table computed compute_stats. Make sure stats table contains do_idx column indexing items sequentially. linetypes boolean show use different linetypes, defaults TRUE. stroke_width numeric stroke width, defaults 1. full_scale boolean scale range 0,100? Defaults TRUE, FALSE cuts max. color_palette character indicating color palette use. Defaults 'color_blind', alternatively choose 'gray'. show points boolean plot show points item? Defaults FALSE.
